prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other, and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. 1. Create a new coordinate system based on the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1875, 0.1875] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines with the following properties: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5625, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.5625, 0.0], End Point [0.5625, 0.5625] - Line 3: Start Point [0.5625, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.5625] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Part 2: Tapered Rectangular Prism Construct a tapered rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system based on the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0797, 0.0657, 0.1875] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines with the following properties: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1791, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1791, 0.0], End Point [0.1791, 0.0392] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1791, 0.0392], End Point [0.0, 0.0392] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0392], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After constructing the parts, extrude them using the specified operations and scale factors. - Part 1 extrusion: - Extrude the sketch by 0.1875 units toward the normal. - Scale the sketch by 0.5625. - Part 2 extrusion: - Extrude the sketch by 0.1875 units toward the normal. - Scale the sketch by 0.1791. - Join the tapered prism to the previously constructed parts.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The part to be constructed is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side angled at 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. The dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, with a white background. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and translation vector `[0.0, 0.45, 0.0]`. This will position and orient the prism on the work plane. **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in the previous step. Draw a series of connected lines and arcs to form a closed loop. The loop should have the following eight lines: - line 1: starting at `[0.0, 0.0]` and ending at `[0.75, 0.0]` - line 2: starting at `[0.75, 0.0]` and ending at `[0.75, 0.525]` - line 3: starting at `[0.75, 0.525]` and ending at `[0.5625, 0.525]` - line 4: starting at `[0.5625, 0.525]` and ending at `[0.5625, 0.375]` - line 5: starting at `[0.5625, 0.375]` and ending at `[0.1875, 0.375]` - line 6: starting at `[0.1875, 0.375]` and ending at `[0.1875, 0.525]` - line 7: starting at `[0.1875, 0.525]` and ending at `[0.0, 0.525]` - line 8: starting at `[0.0, 0.525]` and ending at `[0.0, 0.0]` **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 to match the width of the prism. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it along the X, Y, and Z axes using the euler angles from the coordinate system. Then, translate the 3D sketch along the Z-axis using the translation vector from the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to create the 3D model. The extrusion depth should be 0.45 units towards the normal, and 0.0 units opposite the normal. The resulting part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the specified dimensions and sloped side.</description>

Line 1: [0.0, 0.1875] to [0.3248, 0.0] 2. Line 2: [0.3248, 0.0] to [0.6495, 0.1875] 3. Line 3: [0.6495, 0.1875] to [0.6495, 0.5625] 4. Line 4: [0.6495, 0.5625] to [0.3248, 0.75] 5. Line 5: [0.3248, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.5625] 6. Line 6: [0.0, 0.5625] to [0.0, 0.1875] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75, which is our sketch scaling factor. **Step 4: Transform the sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by using the same coordinate system. The Euler angles provided will maintain the sketch on the X-Y plane. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.2633 in the positive Z direction using our extrusion parameter. This results in the pyramid base CAD part.</description>
